definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

sentences.english: We should abandon all outmoded conventions and customs to keep pace with new era.
sentences.chinese: 我们要抛弃陈规陋习以跟上新时代的步伐。

sentences.english: Do my friends think I'm stuck in a rut or open to new experiences?
sentences.chinese: 朋友们认为我是墨守陈规还是善于创新？

sentences.english: Outdated conventions and bad customs hamper the growth of production.
sentences.chinese: 陈规陋习妨碍生产的发展。

sentences.english: They are at the same time sensitive to the rights of the individual and habitual conformist.
sentences.chinese: 他们十分在乎个人的权利，又习惯于墨守陈规。

sentences.english: But Jin Shidu the narrow boards memory's appearance has broken this outmoded rules and regulations.
sentences.chinese: 但金士顿窄板内存的出现则打破了这一陈规。

sentences.english: Shuffle off normal practices and say goodbye to stereotypes, which is the only way to art learning.
sentences.chinese: 走出成法，告别陈规，这是学习艺术的必经之路。

sentences.english: But I'm a firm believer in paradigm-breaking. Outside-the-box thinking.
sentences.chinese: 但我坚信突破，也就是打破陈规的思维方式。

sentences.english: Mediocrity and inner frustration are the true price of conforming.
sentences.chinese: 平庸无才和内心挫折才是默守陈规真正的代价。

definition: (idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
